results.title: Skiing: beginning movements
results.brief_description: This film is designed for individuals or groups who want to learn correct skiing techniques. The film uses slow motion, stop-action, close-ups and animation to show a wide variety of techniques. One skier performs the techniques described, another demonstrates the steps to reinforce the concepts.

results.title: Skiing at Chateau Tongariro
results.brief_description: Chateau Tongariro is a popular skiing resort near Mt Ngaurahoe, the snow-covered volcanic peak. Shows the hotel and ski huts, lessons on the learners’ slopes, the national downhill course, slalom practice, chair and T-bar lifts, the national ski-jumping championships and speed trials; Cradle Lake and the views from the mountains.

results.title: Skiing's different
results.creator_credit: Motion Picture Associates, Film Australia, Peter Johnson, Edwin Moses and Department of Home Affairs
results.brief_description: Examines possible skiing accidents and the way in which the right clothes, correctly fitting equipment, and commonsense can prevent disaster on the slopes. Narrated by Barry Eaton

results.title: Ski!
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description: This film offers a persuasive call to action and an invitation to all Canadians to take advantage of what they have so much of - the finest ski conditions in the world. How easy it is to start and the highly qualified help available are demonstrated as the film follows a family of four who discover the pleasures of skiing as a family sport.

results.title: Ski tips II with Martin Heckelman
results.brief_description: This is a ski video directed towards intermediate and advanced skiers. Professional ski instructor, Martin Heckelman, author of the “Hamlyn Guide to Skiing”, takes the viewer through the shortswing turn, wedelning, recreational racing and all the advanced manoeuvres that make skiing on moguls and steep slopes easier. Using easy to follow freeze-frame and slow motion sequences the video demonstrates both the correct way to perform each manoeuvre and all the common errors to be avoided.

results.title: Ski tips I with Martin Heckelman
results.brief_description: This is an excellent video for beginners and intermediate skiers. Professional ski instructor, Martin Heckelman, author of the “Hamlyn Guide to Skiing”, takes the viewer through every step leading to the parallel turn including putting on your skis correctly, skiing on ice, and turning on moguls. Using easy to follow freeze-frame and slow motion sequences the video demonstrates both the correct way to perform each manoeuvre and all the common errors to be avoided. Filmed entirely on location in Val D’Isere, France.

results.title: Ski the outer limits
results.creator_credit: Summit Films, Pyramid Films, Barry Corbet, Roger C. Brown, Joern Gerots and Norman G. Dyhrenfurth
results.brief_description: Photographed at Vail, Jackson Hole, Taos, Chamonix, Kitzbuhel and elsewhere, this film shows skiing at its finest. It illustrates the technique, daring, inventiveness, and the free spirit necessary to push towards the outer limits of one’s ability. Slow motion and natural speed show the style, control, balance and discipline required.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Summit Films, Pyramid Films, Barry Corbet, Roger C. Brown, Joern Gerots and Norman G. Dyhrenfurth

results.title: Ski patrol
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and K Sternberg
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the ski patrols on the snow-fields of the Australian Alps. In mountain country, clouds gather quickly, often bringing howling blizzards in which familiar landmarks soon disappear from sight. In cases of emergency, it is “action stations” for the ski patrols, manned by skiers who know the country well. The action of the film culminates in the rescue of an injured skier lost in a raging blizzard. Commentator: Allan Ashbolt
